aboutme.title: Daniel Falcão
aboutme.pleasure: Building systems that can accurately reflect a company's true value.

project0.name: Queue Manager System
project0.description: Queue manager system organizes and manages the lines of clinics, allowing transfers of clients, highlighting in attendance and history record with possibility of redial. A microservice integrates and synchronizes data.
project0.details: The purpose of this queue manager was to organize the attendance lines of various medical clinics. Developed in partnership with a company, it is now used for the management of 3 occupational health clinics. This system uses the socket.io library under the cloths, to ensure an instantaneous update on the screen where the queue is being displayed. The queue view uses the POOLING approach in the database, using the cron library, this approach has been used to ensure that data is updated within a user-defined X time period.

project1.name: TransiScale
project1.description: Tool that assists managers in the transition from 6x1 to 4x3 scales, simulating operational impacts and suggesting automatic adjustments in shifts. The system considers workload, mandatory time off and labor laws, ensuring efficiency, employee welfare and continuity of operations.
project1.details: TransiScale was a system that was developed during an online programming competition. The system was developed in NestJS, taking advantage of the ease and speed of the framework to deliver as soon as possible. The system had JWT authentication and password HASH encryption.

project2.name: GerenciaBook
project2.description: Book Loan Manager! This system was designed to make it easier to manage book loans. It allows user authentication, registration, and CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for a school's book collection.
project2.details: GerenciaBook was developed to modernize the book loan management system at a public school. It features user authentication, role-based access control, and complete CRUD operations for books and students. The system also records loan history, returns, and delays, making it easier to track the library inventory. The backend was built with Node.js, TypeScript, and PostgreSQL, while the frontend uses React. The project runs in Docker containers and includes Jest tests to ensure code stability and quality.

project4.name: Bookshelf
project4.description: Here are all the books I’ve read throughout my days on Earth and what I thought about them. Just remember, I’m not a professional book reviewer—just a developer and a curious guy.
project4.details: Bookshelf is a personal project created to record and share my reading journey over time. Built with React and JavaScript, it features a clean and intuitive interface that lets me organize books by category, add personal notes, and reflect on each read. The app also integrates with a public books API to display covers and additional information. The design is minimalist and fully optimized for mobile use.

project5.name: ALX Sonorização
project5.description: Landing Page developed for a sound and events company.
project5.details: The ALX Sonorização landing page was designed to present the company’s services in a professional and responsive way. Built with React and TypeScript, the project focuses on showcasing the brand identity and event portfolio through smooth transitions and modern visuals. The page includes sections for services, a photo gallery, and a functional contact form integrated with email. It’s hosted on Vercel for optimized performance and fast load times.
